Draw the inner rectangle with the following vertices (using lines): - Corner 1: (0.0977, 0.0) - Corner 2: (0.1954, 0.0) - Corner 3: (0.1954, 0.1562) - Corner 4: (0.0977, 0.1562) 3. Verify the loops are closed and the faces are fully bounded. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter: 0.4688 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (-90, 0, 0) and translation vector [0.0, 0.2344, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1172 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.1172 Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Draw the circle centered at (0.1367, 0.1367) with a radius of 0.1367. 2. Draw a smaller circle centered at (0.1367, 0.1367) with a radius of 0.0781. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter: 0.2734 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector [0.0977, 0.0977, 0.25] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.5 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 Please note that the final shape is a cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on one end, which has been achieved by combining the created parts.</description>
